acceptance: On the demo bench, repeated restart checks were executed: after 50 cycles, no checksum mismatch is observed between active and backup slots.
assumptions: Configuration is stored in non-volatile memory with a limited number of write cycles.
conditions: The demo repository is loaded locally; operations are executed through the CookaReq CLI.
notes: Derived LLR without upward traceability: this requirement is fixed at the implementation level of the persistence mechanism.
rationale: Rationale: this requirement is derived from flash-memory constraints and state-recovery experiments after restart. No direct SYS/HLR linkage is recorded because it constrains the internal commit protocol implementation.
statement: The CONFIG_STORE component shall perform a two-phase commit before writing a new configuration, with atomic active-slot switch and SHA-256 checksum persistence.
title: LLR-09 Atomic configuration commit
